title: Mum, 25, found seriously injured in house next to dead man 'wished she could run away' day before tragedy
text:
News Mum, 25, found seriously injured in house next to dead man 'wished she could run away' day before tragedy The shocking incident was reportedly witnessed by Sandie Rayne's two-year-old daughter and the toddler is now being cared for by relatives Share The attack on Sandie Rayne was reportedly witnessed by her daughter (Photo: Facebook) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! A mum who was found severely injured in a house alongside a man's dead body posted a heartbreaking message on Facebook saying she wanted to "run away". 
Sandie Rayne, 25, suffered extensive injuries after she was reportedly attacked in front of her two-year-old daughter. 
Police discovered Sandie and the man's body yesterday afternoon. They are not searching for any further suspects. 
Sandie wrote on Facebook a day before the tragedy: "Wants to run away somewhere no one knows you or your business and just start all over again if anyone knows a place let me know." The mum suffered "extensive injuries" in the incident (Photo: Facebook) The house has been sealed off for forensic tests (Photo: SWNS.com) Read More Police find young girl in home alongside man's dead body and seriously injured woman 
And several days earlier she said: "Don't you wish you could just run away and hide where no one can find you." 
Sandie's mum Tracie, 46, said: "We hope Sandie pulls through. We don't want to say any more about it. Sorry." 
The incident unfolded in the Leicestershire town of Ashby. Sandie revealed she wanted to "run away" just one day before the tragedy (Photo: Facebook) Police investigate outside the house (Photo: leicestermercury.co.uk) 
The child was unharmed and is being cared for by relatives. 
The house has been cordoned off for forensic tests. The cause of the man's death is not clear. 
A Leicestershire Police spokesman said: "The investigation is in its early stages, but at this point detectives are not looking for anyone else in connection with the enquiry. Officers are appealing for witnesses (Photo: leicestermercury.co.uk) Police swooped on the bungalow yesterday afternoon (Photo: leicestermercury.co.uk) Read More Couple arrested 'trying to kidnap premature baby from hospital may have struck on another ward just days earlier' 
"They have stressed that whilst the local community will be shocked by news of this incident, they should not be alarmed about their own personal safety." 
Graham Allman, a district councillor in the town, told the Leicester Mercury : "Obviously something tragic has happened and it's most unfortunate. 
"My thoughts and feelings go out to all those who are affected by this. The location of the tragedy in Holland Crescent (Photo: leicestermercury.co.uk) Read More 
"I was in Ashby and I did hear a lot of sirens at about half past three. That's not unusual these days, unfortunately. 
"One of my staff told me she had heard something about a death in Ashby." 
A resident who lives near to the bungalow where the incident happened said: "He was in his late 20s and the woman is probably in her mid 20s. 
"The little girl must have been about two years old. The incident happened in Holland Crescent, Leicestershire (Photo: leicestermercury.co.uk) 
"The woman and the little girl are great. I only said hello to him once and he didn't reply. He used to go out to work early most days on a motorbike. 
"As far as I know it was just the three of them in the house." 
Anyone with information about the incident at 3.20pm on Thursday in Holland Crescent is asked to call police on 101. Like us on Facebook
